titlestmt.titleproper: Overview of the Zygmunt Nagorski papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-11-17T12:43-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: 2017 Nov 17: Update extents, added incemental materials 2017 Nov 7: Vishnu added motion picture series and items September 27, 2010: updated extent statement, added container list description note

physdesc.extent: 17 manuscript boxes, 3 motion picture film reels

did.abstract: Correspondence, diaries, memoirs, speeches and writings, personal documents, printed matter, photographs, and motion picture film, relating to Poland during World War II, and to postwar international relations and American foreign policy.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p:
Collection is open for research.
The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Zygmunt Nagorski papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2009.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Polish-American journalist; information officer, United States Information Agency

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, diaries, memoirs, speeches and writings, personal documents, printed matter, photographs, and motion picture film, relating to Poland during World War II, and to postwar international relations and American foreign policy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Footage of Robert F. Kennedy's visit to South Korea in January, 1964.

did.unittitle: Remainder of the collection not yet described
